definitions.text: an implement consisting of a length of wood
examples: he collected dry sticks for a campfire
the kid had a candied apple on a stick

definitions.text: a small thin branch of a tree
a lever used by a pilot to control the ailerons and elevators of an airplane
a rectangular quarter pound block of butter or margarine
informal terms for the leg
examples: fever left him weak on his sticks

definitions.text: a long implement (usually made of wood) that is shaped so that hockey or polo players can hit a puck or ball
a long thin implement resembling a length of wood
examples: cinnamon sticks
a stick of dynamite

definitions.text: marijuana leaves rolled into a cigarette for smoking
threat of a penalty
examples: the policy so far is all stick and no carrot

definitions.text: put, fix, force, or implant
examples: lodge a bullet in the table
stick your thumb in the crack

definitions.text: stay put (in a certain place)
examples: We are staying in Detroit; we are not moving to Cincinnati
Stay put in the corner here!
Stick around and you will learn something!

definitions.text: stick to firmly
examples: Will this wallpaper adhere to the wall?

definitions.text: be or become fixed
examples: The door sticks--we will have to plane it

definitions.text: endure
examples: The label stuck to her for the rest of her life

definitions.text: be a devoted follower or supporter
examples: The residents of this village adhered to Catholicism
She sticks to her principles

definitions.text: be loyal to
examples: She stood by her husband in times of trouble
The friends stuck together through the war

definitions.text: cover and decorate with objects that pierce the surface
examples: stick some feathers in the turkey before you serve it

definitions.text: fasten with an adhesive material like glue
examples: stick the poster onto the wall

definitions.text: fasten with or as with pins or nails
examples: stick the photo onto the corkboard

definitions.text: fasten into place by fixing an end or point into something
examples: stick the corner of the sheet under the mattress

definitions.text: pierce with a thrust using a pointed instrument
examples: he stuck the cloth with the needle

definitions.text: pierce or penetrate or puncture with something pointed
examples: He stuck the needle into his finger

definitions.text: come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation
examples: The dress clings to her body
The label stuck to the box
The sushi rice grains cohere

definitions.text: saddle with something disagreeable or disadvantageous
examples: They stuck me with the dinner bill
I was stung with a huge tax bill

definitions.text: be a mystery or bewildering to
examples: This beats me!
Got me--I don't know the answer!
a vexing problem
This question really stuck me
